data.output: Some days I feel I only exist to sleep, work, eat, repeat. An endless cycle of doom and gloom, how I long for the Christmas break coming up. My final payment on the cottage in the countryside is just in reach and I can spend my days lounging around and taking in all the fresh air, freedom!

Once upon a time, an ancient king required his subjects to make payment on their 18th birthday, so that they could exist within his kingdom. If payment was not made, they would be executed in front of the entire town. This brought on a lot of feelings of gloom between his subjects, as many people could not afford to make the payment.

What a fantastic day to exist. The sun is shining in the bright blue sky which is such a lovely change to the gloom-laden skies of late. Grey, rainy days have now been usurped with the payment of such glorious weather for once this awful summer.

Ben saw the figure come out of the gloom. He approached and Ben discreetly passed him the payment. The figure reciprocated by passing Ben the envelope before walking off into the mist. A moment later he was gone, as if he never existed.

She didn't want to exist anymore. She had made the final payment on her mortgage, and now owned the house she had been living in for forty years - but all she felt was gloom. In every ten year plan she made, she allowed herself some breathing space - she would finally achieve her dreams once she had paid that final sum. She couldn't bring herself to do anything now that she was there.

'I no longer wish to exist' said the despondent boy sat underneath the tree - it seemed as though his gloom had finally overcome him entirely. As he sat, he reflected on the terrible events of his life - he had made payment after payment but never received anything in return and now it seemed as though his days were numbered. Eventually, he rose and, wiping the tear from his eye, began to walk solemnly into the dark evening's mist.

With despair, I ask my husband how can we exist on so little money, The payment to the tax office has taken so much of our money already.  Not only this, but there is a chill in the air.  Winter is approaching with it bringing the doom and gloom of high energy bills.

My friend said three words when we were playing chinese whisper. I had no idea what did she say but I herd some of it. On my turn I said the words bloom, cavemen, exist. Finally I came to know that the words were gloom, payment and exist.

To exist in this world you must make a payment, the second you are born that payment is your life. To exist and feel in this world you must experience extremes. How can you know happiness without knowing sadness. How can you feel excitement without knowing gloom.
The dark grey skies gave a sense of gloom to Marly as she walked to the market. She made her payment and walked home with her 4 green apples. "Am I just born to exist?", she asked herself.

A plush of the pokemon gloom, which is one of my favourites, is so hard to come by nowadays that i would make a substatial payment to purchase one that exists. I would even travel the globe to aquire one. But alas, i believe that they stopped making them a while ago, so i will need to find an alternative source.

It was a day full of despair and gloom, I felt so down thinking about the payment that was missing from my bank account.  It was causing so much bother at home and I just didn't know what to do about it.  Did I imagine it? Did it really exist? Did someone hack into my account?

In the place I live, we all have to pay this strange tax, just so we could dream of a better future. They called it "the delusion tax," and without it, life felt empty. Nothing mattered. The world didn’t really exist beyond the gray skies and the constant gloom. Most people struggled to afford it, being more expensive every time. But we made the payments anyway, because without those dreams, we’d have nothing to look forward to. I remember scraping together every coin, desperate for some small hope, some vision that things might change. Without those dreams, people just gave up, and I myself couldn't bear living like that.

On a faithful Christmas eve in the city of Paris, there was an auction that was live with an outrageous price. The painting was a basic picture of mary and  this gave a gloomy looks on all those that were present as the painting was not special and there was need for an immediate payment before the best bidder could exist the venue.

Rose shouldn't be forced to exist in this gloom. The UK weather was so depressing. "Get me on a plane to hotter climes immediately!" she demanded.  Waving her credit card around she screamed "Come on people! Allow me to make that payment".

Make payment to exist in the gloom of Britain, not a political slogan that was expected to work but somehow did for Ted the budding politician. He wanted to campaign on taxes being too high and how this effects the general mood of the country, he was right! He won by a landslide and became prime minister within 10 years, unfortunately he was useless and the country entered a long recession period.

Marcus peered through the gloom. "Why were there no lights?" he wondered, as he cupped his hands against the window to try and see inside the house. Perhaps the family had failed to make their payment, but without power in the midst of this winter, the family would suffer fatally. There was no sign of life inside, and Marcus prayed silently they had moved on before the freeze and weren't to be found inside. Once, there were charities to help and places to go, but in these no longer exist: too many require help, and no one has any left to give.

It was that time of year when there was a lot of gloom around. This was because it was time for the payment of council tax. A new rule meant that even if you did not have a house if you exist then you pay.

The current political climate left Rachel feeling a sense of gloom. She wondered what she had done to exist in a time where there was such divide in the world, a world filled with war, violence, and poverty. Rachel sought out a number of charities, where she learned that for a small payment she could contribute to efforts tackling the issues she cared about in the world. Rachel felt less gloomy, as she read the inspirational stories of the charities, and her outlook on the world was brighter.

Sarah was suffering with a case of the blues lately, it was all doom and gloom in her mind and feeling like she was simply existing rather than living.  Sarah felt like her adult days were poor, one payment after the other coming out of her hard earned money.  She told everyone around her she was all work and no play in order to simply exist in the world, and it was not the life she wanted.

The gloom had reached the house. It was mid winter and cold outside. He thought how could anyone exist like this? And to make matters worse make payment to their landlord. It was a harsh environment that they wouldn't wish on anyone.

The single mother rushed home as awaited the news of the latest lottery draw. Her ticket was kindly given to her by her son, Phil. Watching in excitement, she was on the edge of her seat as each number matched the draw thinking about all the payments she could make. In ecstacity, she leapt out of her seat as she discovered she won the jackpot! However, she soon learns that her son Phil was pranking her, plummeting her joy to an all-time low, all she felt was gloom as she wished her son ceased to exist.

The weather was dull and gave a sense of gloom. Someone was buying products in a shop, gave their payment for the products to a cashier then left the shop. As they were walking outside it started to rain. Raindrops appeared to exist

The three best friends Erin, Geri and Holly were on their way to their first ever spiritual retreat. "Just going to go do the parking payment" Holly called as the girls got out of the car. "I can't wait to just exist for the next few days at the retreat! No more doom and gloom at work!"  Geri said to Erin.

She sat behind her computer screen staring into the emptiness. There was a sense of foreboding and an existential question she could not help but ask herself. Why do I exist? For what purpose and will my life ever change for the better.  The despair was encompassing. She shook her heads and then her arms outwards as if to shake off the gloom of realising that her life was purposeless. Again she asked, were her misfortunes payment for some previous ill lived life - cosmic karma. She got up off of her chair moving slowly towards the front door to listen to the bristle of  empty silence. This was her life she thought. It would never agbe replete again with joy.
